column1: “Our veterans have never been indifferent.  They volunteered rolled up their sleeves and helped make a better world.  We have all been the beneficiaries.  Let’s do more than thank and honor them this year.  Let’s all try to be more like them."   https://t.co/4JpcajgdIP https://t.co/UeCcT5SomA
Supporting our democratic institutions and process is more important than any party person or interests.

While the courts work their way through legal challenges this is a time for each American to put the best interests of the nation first.  This country is closely divided and we have to find a way to come together.
Placing politics over substance guarantees lasting damage to our military and our country as a whole.  We need to pass bipartisan legislation that moves the country forward. https://t.co/hkIVCyQGar.

Our national security and military are not bargaining chips.  Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats have once again pushed partisan legislation adding unrelated provisions and using political games to prevent necessary funds from reaching our servicemembers and their families.

Congress owes that support to the brave men and women who risk their lives to protect our nation.  Even in today’s partisan times I hope we will continue to stand together to support national security and our servicemembers. https://t.co/wuhek7N3G0

When it comes to National Defense there are no Republicans or Democrats there are only Americans.  Whether you are a soldier on a hill in Afghanistan or on a ship out in the middle of the Pacific you need to know that the whole country is behind you.
It has been and continues to be my great privilege to work for the 13th District for members of our military and their families and for our country. https://t.co/blkQsgqrRp

I am very grateful to serve on the House Armed Services Committee and I know that it has only been possible because the people of the 13th Congressional District of Texas elected me to be their voice in Washington.
Thank you to all the reporters who have stuck with us through long markups year after year.  We are in the home stretch and the RipIts are available in the hearing room!
The Markup of NDAA for FY21 is underway. Follow along here: https://t.co/DAOp7qNKFp
Note: The appearance of U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) visual information does not imply or constitute DoD endorsement.

NDAA is one of the only examples of traditional legislating that still occurs today  going all the way through subcommittee committee and the House and Senate floor.  The 60th consecutive NDAA remains necessary in “providing for the common defense.” https://t.co/6McmuemK8y

Every single year since 1961 Congress and Presidents of both parties have worked together to enact a National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) that provides authorization for everything related to the military.  The
And thank you for your thoughtful heartfelt video about race in the military and in the country.  Every American should watch it.
Congratulations to General Charles Q. Brown Jr. a distinguished Texas Tech graduate who was confirmed by the Senate yesterday as the new Chief of Staff of the Air Force by a vote of 98 to 0.

Each of us has the right of free expression under the First Amendment but there is no excuse for burning looting or destroying property.  The country is facing some very difficult challenges right now. At every level we can do better and we can be better.
The death of George Floyd in Minneapolis was a crime and should not have happened.  I am grateful to all of those who ensured that the demonstrations in our area have remained peaceful.

The Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) so vital to saving small businesses and keeping their employees on the payroll  has run out of money.  Democratic leaders in Congress just need to say “yes” in order to keep the program working.

Today Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin announced that the IRS will move the tax filing deadline to July 15th this year providing important relief to taxpayers. Congress is also continuing to work on a bill to further assist taxpayers and the economy.

I appreciate the President acting quickly to sign this bill into law. It will help workers and businesses as well as remove financial obstacles to testing. It is also important to see that children and other vulnerable populations are able to get meals. https://t.co/KyzU8XpxA3
